sub_title: Product Manager B2B Partnerships at EasyPark
summary:
I am a project manager passionate about urban innovation with special interest on its integration in urban policies.
In the last years, I have been involved in projects related to sustainable mobility, platform economy and (over)tourism management.

education.degree_name: Research Master in Urban Studies (1st year)
Master en Política Territorial y Urbanística

projects.title: Urban IxD project, European Commission, Future and Emerging Technologies Programme
projects.description:
The new concept Urban Interaction Design (UrbanIxD) compresses the new existing relationships in the hybrid city, where the physical environment is every day more mixed with the digital world.

I was selected among 300 applicants together with other 35 designers, developers and urban thinkers in order to create Urban IxD projects through a critical design methodology. 

My project, "Coordination of Urban Busy Areas", analyzes the future implications of massive tourism in the city of Split (Croatia) through an augmented reality application.

- "Coordination of Urban Busy Areas" is being displayed on the exhibition "city-data-future" in Venice, Italy, during the Architecture Bienale.

contributors.headline: Product Manager B2B Partnerships at EasyPark

courses.name: Agilidad y Lean. Gestionando los proyectos y negocios del s. XXI (7ª. edición)

profile_positions.description:
EasyPark Group is a leading, fast growing parking tech company that helps drivers find and manage parking and charge their electrical vehicle. Our unique and cutting-edge technology also helps businesses, cities, parking operators and property owners with administration, planning, and data driven management across the globe. We make urban life easier, one parking spot at a time.

EasyPark Group has a unique market coverage with presence in over 25 countries and more than 3,200 cities through our apps EasyPark, PARK NOW, Parkmobile, RingGo and Park-line. The markets we are active in include Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, the U.S, the U.K, Germany, France, the Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Switzerland, Austria, Slovenia, Serbia, Montenegro, Lichtenstein, Iceland, Hungary, Australia and New Zealand.

Together we are a diverse team of nearly 1000 employees across the globe who stay true to our values while making cities more liveable. You will find our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.
profile_positions.title: Product Manager - B2B Partnerships

profile_positions.description:
PARK NOW Group is the no. 1 parking provider. We’re driven by one thing: making our cities healthier, cleaner and more liveable. Transforming cities into places where people can move around freely with easy to use mobility solutions while reducing congestion and pollution. How? By unlocking the power of technology to make parking simple, quick and effortless for drivers, operators and cities. 
 
PARK NOW Group currently offers the no. 1 parking app. We’re proudly representing our brands including Parkmobile, RingGo, ParkNow and Park-line. With 440 parking pioneers, we serve clients throughout Europe from our offices in Diemen (Amsterdam, NL), Berlin (DE), Versailles (FR), Basingstoke (UK) and Berchem (BE). 
 
PARK NOW is part of YOUR NOW, the global joint venture in mobility solutions founded by BMWGroup and Daimler AG. We offer car sharing, ride-hailing, charging and parking solutions to help people navigate their urban journey’s.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager B2B

profile_positions.description:
Fairbnb.coop is a P2P vacation rental platform with a social and commons orientation. 
I was one of the concept developers. In addition to general/operational functions, among my duties have been the laison and negotiation with municipalities (Amsterdam, Barcelona, Valencia, Venice and Bologna) regarding taxation and regulation of vacation rentals.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder / Project and Operations manager

profile_positions.description:
LEDGER (ledgerproject.eu) is an EU funded project that empowers people to solve problems using decentralised technologies such blockchain, peer to peer or distributed ledger technologies.

The program will fund and provide technical and business mentoring to 32 projects, which will build their Minimum viable products (MVPs) where privacy by design, openness and citizen data sovereignity are at the core of their proposition.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Smart Buddy is a platform for citizens of Santander and international tourists visiting Santander. It allows Santander’s local residents to make recommendations of events and places to tourists visiting the city. It was co-created by City Makers and citizens of Santander as OrganiCity experiment.

“The objective of Smart Buddy was to involve neighbours in the tourism management of their city; by showing venues that are often not displayed on tourism city maps or other internet platforms to foster the economic development of these less touristy areas.”

More than 60 people from neighbourhood associations attended the project launch, including the Santander Councillor of Tourism (Gema Igual) and the Councillor for Neighbourhoods and Participation (Carmen Ruiz).
We held two stakeholder workshops with 20 neighbourhood associations to gather content for the platform. 33 people attended in total. The platform was developed based on the information they provided.
We organised several ‘area-specific’ meetings in different neighbourhoods to test and iterate the platform with real users from the area.
When the platform was almost ready, we met with the students from the Tourism University Altamira to receive their feedback and gather more information about Santander.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Smart Fiets was one of the 7 projects selected for the Amsterdam Startup in Residence accelerator, which took place from November 2015 to March 2016.
It is an innovative solution which will end the problem of abandoned bicycles in Amsterdam and will enhance the efficiency of Amsterdam’s bicycle collection system.
The project is based in Smart Fiets Manager, a centralized IT solution for all stakeholders involved in the abandoned bicycle system. With this new system, all bicycles introduced in the system by citizens, Handhaving or Smart Fiets Collectors will go to the Smart Fiets Manager back-end system, a database shared by all actors.
These are the features that a centralized system could provided:
1. Public participation in the bike collection management: Smart Fiets provides a mechanism for citizens to report abandoned bikes with the Smart Fiets App in three steps (1- Place a sticker on the abandoned bicycle; 2- Scan its QR-code; 3- Add picture and details of the bike).
This bikes will be picked up by a dedicated team. By separating the collection of soft bikes (abandoned and neglected bikes with almost or no value) and hard bikes (long-term parked or wrongly parked bikes) the efficiency of the bicycle collection system will be increased.

2- Transparency of the bicycle collection system: Smart Fiets will provide a way to register bikes and a service that will allow users to check whether their bicycle has been transferred to the Fietsdepot in case of loss. In that case, they will be able to claim them back online. In case it is not there, users will be able to report its loss to the police.

3. Automatization of Fietsdepot: With Smart Fiets the process of Fietsdepot will be completely improved. That will result in an optimization of resources of bike deposit.

company.name: University of Applied Sciences of Amsterdam, Interactieve Media

profile_positions.company: University of Applied Sciences of Amsterdam, Interactieve Media
profile_positions.description:
Guest lecturer in 2013 and 2014 at “City Discourse”, a 9 weeks course within the minor Communication and Mobile technology. 
The first part of the course had a practical approach focusing on the existing urban technologies of our cities. The second part was an Urban Interaction Design workshop oriented to create interactive designs on the future hybrid city based on the knowledge acquired in the first part.

- Leading the 30 students to integrate different perspectives including economy, society and environment in their urban innovation projects.

- Framing the urban innovation within different "smart city" fields.

- Introducing Urban Interaction Design to students.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Play the City invents new methods for interactive city-making by integrating city gaming, digital public polls, co-design and social networks with traditional architecture and urbanism. 

I developed the “Majority Report”, an open research project on interactive city tools, which are projects characterized by the communication between its users -citizens, businesses and/or public administration. We analyzed more than 200 of this tools, sorting them by fields and characteristics. This research directed us to the application of technology in the city and into the field of smart cities.

-	Deep knowledge on characteristics of urban innovation projects.

-	Analysis of keys for success or failure of interactive city tools.

-	Public presentation of preliminary conclusions at Pakhuis de Zwijger, Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Researcher - Urban Innovation & Smart Cities

volunteer_experiences.role: Legal translation into Spanish of Urban Commons' regulatory law

company.name: LabGov Bologna - Laboratory for the Governance of the Commons

volunteer_experiences.description:
Legal translation from English and Italian into Spanish of legal text "Regulation on The Collaboration Among Citizens and the City for the Care and Regeneration of Urban Commons".
This text was approved for first time in Bologna and constitutes a base for future regulations in urban commons for other cities in Europe and around the world.
